reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Supporting HIV response by reducing new infections and AIDS related morbidity and mortality

description.narrative: Rwanda - HIV - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Rwanda - MOH. This program has the following goals: New HIV infections are reduced by 2020. HIV related deaths and comorbidities are reduced. People infected and affected by HIV have the same opportunities as the general population. The objectives of this program are: New infection in children are remained below 5% by 2020. New HIV infections by sexual transmission reduced. New HIV infections by sexual transmission reduced. Reduction of new HIV infection and hepatitis through blood borne transmission. The coverage of ART and the VL suppression among PLHIV on Treatment are increased. People living with HIV receive standardized adequate care and support. PLHIV have reduced morbidity related to STI, OI and other co-morbidities. People infected and affected by HIV and MVC have improved socio-economic status and protection. SGBV and HIV related stigma and discrimination are reduced

description.narrative: Living support to client/ target population (LSCTP)

title.narrative: Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Number of medical male circumcisions performed according to national standards
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
PMTCT-Other 1: Percentage of exposed infants who are HIV-free by 24 months
TCS-Other 1: Percentage of exposed infants who are HIV-free by 18 months
HIV O-1: Percent of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
TCS-Other 1: Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
HIV O-5: Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART, who have a suppressed viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
HIV O-4a: Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
